text: A project manager has just been assigned to lead a large digital transformation initiative. Multiple business units have different interpretations of the project goals. What should the project manager do FIRST?
answers: Create a detailed project schedule to align everyone on timelines
Facilitate workshops with key stakeholders to develop a shared vision
Assign a vision statement to each team based on their department
Escalate the disagreement to senior management for resolution

text: During project execution, a newly hired team member expresses confusion about the project's strategic direction, which seems different from what was communicated six months ago. What is the BEST action for the project manager?
answers: Tell the team member that the original vision is still valid and unchanged
Review and update the shared vision to reflect current realities and communicate it
Redirect the team member to re-read the original project charter
Escalate the concern to the project sponsor only

text: A project manager discovers that two key stakeholders have fundamentally different understandings of the project's success criteria. What technique should the project manager use to identify the root cause of this misunderstanding?
answers: Ishikawa diagram analysis
Risk register review
Stakeholder impact assessment
Decomposing the situation to identify the source of the vision conflict

text: Two senior engineers on an agile team have ongoing conflicts about technical implementation choices, disrupting sprint velocity. What should the project manager do FIRST?
answers: Separate the engineers into different teams
Identify and analyze the sources of the conflict
Report the conflict to HR immediately
Reassign one engineer to a different project

text: During a retrospective, team members reveal that unresolved interpersonal conflicts are affecting morale. The project manager has established ground rules. What should be the NEXT step?
answers: Replace the ground rules with stricter policies
Manage and rectify ground rule violations that are occurring
Disband the current team structure
Cancel retrospectives until the conflict is resolved

text: A project manager is leading a hybrid project. A conflict has emerged between the predictive planning team and the agile delivery team about reporting frequency. Which is the BEST first action?
answers: Mandate a single reporting approach for all teams
Analyze the context of the conflict and understand each team's needs
Create a new governance document to resolve the issue
Remove reporting requirements for the agile team

text: After implementing a conflict resolution strategy, the project manager notices that conflicts between the same stakeholders are recurring. What should the project manager do?
answers: Implement a different agreed-on resolution strategy
Document the conflict and move on
Remove the stakeholders from the project
Escalate the situation to the PMO

text: A project manager is leading a self-organizing agile team. The team is struggling with unclear responsibilities. What should the project manager do?
answers: Create a rigid organizational chart with detailed reporting lines
Establish clear roles and responsibilities within the team
Assign all decisions to the most senior team member
Remove underperforming members immediately

text: A technically strong project manager tends to solve every problem personally, which is creating a bottleneck. Senior leadership wants the team to be more autonomous. What is the BEST course of action?
answers: Continue solving problems to maintain quality
Empower the team to solve problems independently and build their capability
Hire more project managers to distribute the workload
Escalate the bottleneck issue to the program manager

text: A project manager is working with a diverse team that includes members from five countries and three time zones. What leadership approach should the project manager adopt?
answers: Standardize all communication to one language and one time zone
Determine an appropriate leadership style that supports the team's varied experiences, skills, and perspectives
Assign leadership to the most experienced team member
Create sub-teams by region to minimize coordination overhead

text: During a steering committee meeting, the project sponsor criticizes the team's approach without understanding the technical constraints. What should the project manager do?
answers: Agree with the sponsor to maintain the relationship
Represent the voice of the team and explain the technical constraints objectively
Ask team members to attend the steering committee
Document the criticism and ignore it

text: A project manager leads a team that includes junior developers, experienced architects, and business analysts. Performance is inconsistent across the team. What should the project manager do FIRST?
answers: Assign the same tasks to everyone regardless of skill level
Establish expectations at the team level aligned with each member's role
Replace junior team members with more experienced staff
Create a performance improvement plan for all team members

text: At the start of a major infrastructure project, the project manager is preparing the stakeholder engagement approach. What is the FIRST step?
answers: Create a stakeholder engagement matrix
Identify all relevant stakeholders
Define communication channels for each stakeholder
Obtain sponsor sign-off on the stakeholder list

text: A government project has a new regulatory body that must approve deliverables. The project manager has not previously considered this group. What should the project manager do?
answers: Proceed without engaging the regulatory body to avoid delays
Analyze the newly identified stakeholder and update the engagement plan
Inform the project sponsor and wait for instructions
Add the regulatory body to the communication plan without analysis

text: A key stakeholder consistently misses project meetings and does not respond to communications. What is the BEST approach?
answers: Remove the stakeholder from the distribution list
Analyze the stakeholder's interests and tailor communication to better match their needs
Escalate the stakeholder's non-participation to HR
Continue sending the same communications and document the non-response

text: A project manager wants to ensure that a skeptical vice president becomes a project champion. What is the MOST effective approach?
answers: Exclude the VP from difficult discussions to avoid resistance
Build trust with the VP and influence them to accomplish project objectives
Create a detailed report to overwhelm the VP with data
Assign a team member to manage the VP's concerns

text: A project manager notices that different stakeholder groups have conflicting expectations about the final product's features. What should the project manager do?
answers: Choose one group's expectations and implement them
Facilitate discussions to align expectations among stakeholder groups
Present all conflicting views to leadership and let them decide
Document the conflicting expectations and move forward

text: A senior stakeholder wants immediate results while an operational team needs more time for proper implementation. What should the project manager do FIRST?
answers: Agree with the senior stakeholder and push the team to deliver faster
Identify and categorize the different stakeholder expectations
Ignore operational concerns and prioritize executive requests
Delay the project until both sides agree

text: A project manager identifies that a junior business analyst has strong technical knowledge that could benefit the development team. What should the project manager do?
answers: Reassign the analyst to the development team permanently
Organize and act on mentoring opportunities to share the analyst's knowledge
Document the analyst's skills for future reference only
Request the analyst to document their technical knowledge in a manual

text: Midway through a project, customer satisfaction surveys indicate increasing dissatisfaction with project progress. What should the project manager do?
answers: Discontinue the surveys to avoid negative feedback
Monitor the customer satisfaction data and respond appropriately to address concerns
Present only positive survey results to stakeholders
Wait until the end of the project to address satisfaction issues

text: A project deliverable has been completed, but the internal customer's expectations about quality differ from what was agreed in the project scope. What is the project manager's BEST course of action?
answers: Accept the complaint and redo the deliverable without discussion
Align and maintain outcomes to internal and external customer expectations through structured discussion
Inform the customer that the deliverable meets contractual requirements
Escalate the matter to the project sponsor for decision

text: A critical team member with unique technical expertise plans to leave the organization before project completion. What should the project manager do FIRST?
answers: Request the team member to extend their stay indefinitely
Identify the knowledge critical to the project and plan for its transfer
Hire an external consultant to replace the team member immediately
Document the issue in the risk register and do nothing further

text: A project team has developed a novel approach to data migration that could benefit other projects in the organization. What should the project manager do to maximize organizational value?
answers: Keep the approach confidential to maintain competitive advantage within the team
Foster an environment for knowledge transfer and share the innovation broadly
Patent the approach before sharing it
Wait until the project closes before documenting the approach

text: During a project closeout, the project manager wants to ensure that operational teams can maintain the new system. What should be done?
answers: Provide the operations team with the final project report only
Gather and transfer project knowledge to the operations team before handover
Assume the operations team will figure it out over time
Schedule a single one-hour briefing session for the operations team

text: A project manager is starting a complex project with 25 stakeholders across four continents. What is the FIRST step in managing communications?
answers: Create a distribution list for all project emails
Define a communication strategy aligned with stakeholder needs and project requirements
Schedule weekly video conferences for all stakeholders
Delegate all communications to the project coordinator

text: An agile team reports that stakeholders are unaware of progress made in recent sprints. What should the project manager do?
answers: Add more documentation requirements to the team's workflow
Establish a feedback loop and promote transparency and collaboration with stakeholders
Create a formal weekly status report for all stakeholders
Invite all stakeholders to every sprint ceremony

text: A project sponsor requires a specific executive summary format for monthly briefings. What should the project manager do?
answers: Standardize all project reports using the most common format
Create reports aligned with sponsor and stakeholder expectations
Use the PMO's standard template regardless of the sponsor's preference
Ask the sponsor to adapt to the project's reporting format

text: During project execution, a project manager realizes that the governance process requires specific reporting milestones that were not initially captured. What is the BEST course of action?
answers: Ignore the governance requirements to avoid schedule impact
Understand the reporting requirements and support reporting and governance processes
Submit a change request to eliminate the governance reporting requirements
Delegate all governance reporting to the PMO

text: A project team's internal communications are effective, but external stakeholders complain they feel left out of important decisions. What should the project manager do?
answers: Create a separate external stakeholder steering committee
Review and expand the communication strategy to include external stakeholders appropriately
Inform external stakeholders that they are not decision-makers
Share all internal communications directly with external stakeholders

text: A project manager is leading an agile team where the Scrum Master says the team lacks motivation during sprint retrospectives. What leadership approach should the project manager consider?
answers: Make attendance at retrospectives mandatory and enforce consequences for disengagement
Determine an appropriate leadership style that motivates the team and empowers their autonomy
Cancel retrospectives until team morale improves
Replace the Scrum Master with someone more engaging

text: A stakeholder has complained to senior management that the project team is not responsive. The project manager was unaware of this issue. What should the project manager do?
answers: Deny the complaint formally in writing
Communicate conflict management principles with the team and establish responsive communication norms
Report the stakeholder to HR for bypassing the project manager
Ask senior management to ignore the complaint

text: During project execution, a previously unengaged stakeholder group suddenly has significant influence over a key deliverable. What should the project manager do?
answers: Delay engaging the group until the deliverable is finalized
Execute the stakeholder engagement plan and optimize alignment between this group and project objectives
Remove the group's influence by escalating to the project sponsor
Create a separate project just for this stakeholder group's needs

text: Two departments have competing priorities for a shared resource on the project. Both believe they have the highest priority. What should the project manager do?
answers: Decide unilaterally which department has priority
Facilitate discussions to align expectations and reach a consensus on prioritization
Let the resource decide their own priorities
Escalate to senior management without attempting alignment

text: A project is three months into execution when the organization announces a strategic pivot. How should the project manager respond?
answers: Complete the project as originally planned regardless of the strategic change
Keep the vision current by reassessing and updating it to align with the new strategic direction
Put the project on hold until the strategic pivot is fully defined
Replace all project objectives with the new strategic objectives immediately

text: An external client has escalating expectations that now exceed the agreed project scope. What is the BEST course of action?
answers: Quietly expand scope to satisfy the client and avoid conflict
Identify external customer expectations, align them with agreed scope, and process any changes through the change control process
Terminate the contract if the client continues to escalate
Ignore the expanded expectations and deliver only what was originally agreed

text: A project is implementing a new ERP system. The project manager is concerned that the IT support team won't be able to maintain it after go-live. What should the project manager do?
answers: Contract the vendor to provide permanent support
Gather critical system knowledge and foster an environment for knowledge transfer to the support team
Train only the team leader and rely on them to cascade knowledge
Defer training until after go-live to save time during the project

text: A team member from a culture where hierarchy is very important is hesitant to voice concerns to the project manager. What is the BEST approach?
answers: Ignore cultural differences and insist on direct communication
Support the team's varied experiences and perspectives by creating safe channels for feedback
Replace the team member with someone more vocal
Have a senior leader force the team member to be more open

text: Two team members have an ongoing dispute that has created factional support groups within the team. The team is becoming divided. What is the FIRST step the project manager should take?
answers: Remove both team members from the project
Establish an environment that fosters adherence to common ground rules and work toward rebuilding unity
Side with the larger faction to resolve the conflict faster
Have both parties sign a formal agreement to stop the conflict

text: A project manager is preparing to engage a large group of external stakeholders for a public sector project. What should be done to ensure communication is effective?
answers: Use the same communication format for all stakeholders
Analyze stakeholders and tailor communication to each group's specific needs and preferences
Hire a public relations firm to manage all external communications
Only communicate with external stakeholders through formal written reports

text: A project manager receives feedback that status reports are too technical for executive stakeholders. What is the BEST course of action?

Review the communication strategy and adjust report formats to align with stakeholder expectations

text: A project manager is leading a cross-functional team with members who have conflicting ideas about what 'done' means for the project. What should the project manager do?

Facilitate a session to help ensure a shared vision with key stakeholders on what project completion looks like
Leave the definition of 'done' open to allow flexibility

text: A highly experienced team member consistently bypasses the project manager to deliver solutions directly to stakeholders. The team admires this person's technical abilities. What should the project manager do?
answers: Report the team member's behavior to HR

Grant the team member formal project lead status

text: After a project review, the project manager realizes that stakeholder expectations have shifted significantly since the project began. What is the MOST appropriate response?

Submit a project change request for each new expectation

text: An internal customer has been satisfied throughout most of the project but is suddenly dissatisfied with recent deliverables without providing specific feedback. What should the project manager do?
answers: Accept the dissatisfaction and move forward
Monitor and respond to the satisfaction data by engaging the customer to understand specific concerns
Inform the customer that their dissatisfaction is unfounded
Escalate the satisfaction issue to the project sponsor immediately

text: A vendor's representative and the project's technical lead have an escalating conflict that is threatening to delay a critical milestone. What is the project manager's BEST course of action?

Analyze the context of the conflict and implement an agreed-on resolution strategy
Let the conflict resolve itself naturally

text: A project manager wants to influence a resistant stakeholder who controls significant project resources. What is the MOST appropriate approach?

Build trust with the stakeholder and align their interests with project objectives
Reduce the project's dependency on the stakeholder's resources

text: An agile team has developed significant implicit knowledge about a complex domain. A new sprint team is set to take over. What is the BEST approach for knowledge transfer?

Let the new team learn through trial and error

text: A project manager learns that informal communications between team members are causing misinformation to spread to stakeholders. What should be done?

Define a communication strategy with clear channels and establish a feedback loop to manage information flow

text: A team member is struggling with a technical problem that no one else on the team can solve. The team member is frustrated and considering leaving the project. What should the project manager do?
answers: Replace the team member with a more experienced resource

Tell the team member to resolve the issue independently

text: Midway through a project, a project manager reviews business conditions and finds that some planned features no longer align with business strategy. What is the BEST course of action?

text: A project team has completed a product increment. The project manager wants to confirm that value has been delivered. What should be established?

text: A project manager discovers that a key skill required for an upcoming project phase is not available within the current team. What is the BEST course of action?

text: During execution, a resource who was committed to the project is temporarily reassigned to an urgent corporate initiative. What should the project manager do?

text: A project requires specialized software development services that the internal team cannot provide. What should the project manager do FIRST?

text: A vendor is consistently missing contractual obligations. What is the project manager's BEST course of action?

text: A project manager needs to procure a complex, technically innovative solution where requirements may evolve. Which contract type is MOST appropriate?

text: A project manager is planning a large infrastructure project. What financial planning activities should be completed during the planning phase?

text: A project is delivering a medical device that must comply with strict FDA regulations. What quality planning activity is MOST critical?

text: When should a project manager baseline the project schedule?

text: A project manager wants to assess whether the project is on track to deliver its intended benefits. What should be done?

Ask the team informally for status updates once a week

text: During a project review, the project manager discovers that some project artifacts are outdated. What should be done?

text: An executive sponsor asks for a monthly dashboard summarizing project health across scope, schedule, cost, and quality dimensions. What should the project manager do?

text: A project has delivered all planned scope but the business sponsor has not formally approved closure. What should the project manager do?

text: A project is nearing completion and needs to transition its deliverables to an operations team. What should the project manager ensure?

text: A project manager must develop a project management plan for a project that has uncertain requirements in the early phases but more stable requirements later. What is the BEST approach?
